channel.description: Recent content in Cisco Routers on 0x000216

item.title: The Internet Launches Into Space
item.description: The internet has conquered Earth and is now reaching for the stars. While “Google ET” might be a bit premature, efforts are underway to extend the internet’s reach into space. The initial steps involve using internet technology within Earth’s orbit. Eventually, we might be assigning planet and galaxy codes to complement our current country codes. But first, let’s explore these initial steps. Cisco is pioneering the use of routers in orbit through a defense department program called IRIS (Internet Routing In Space).

item.title: Cisco's New Terabit Monster Router
item.description: Cisco’s latest edge router, the ASR 9000, significantly increases network bandwidth capacity. This powerful router can handle a massive 6.4 Tbps with a 400 Gbps per slot configuration. While not necessary for small businesses, the ASR 9000 targets large service providers dealing with the ever-growing demand for video content. The surge in internet video consumption, from platforms like YouTube to embedded video content, is pushing service providers to their limits in bandwidth provisioning.
